Description: Pale-brown chert axe-head: of deep rounded form with rough lugs. The blade, which is very thick in section, has been flaked bifacially but the cutting edge has been formed by flaking mainly from one face. The butt seems to have been slightly convex. The cutting edge is uneven but sharp. One lug is almost completely lost, and one of the sides is chipped.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Illahun, Kahun and Gurob’ 1889-1890 (London 1891), 12, 51-2, pl. VII, 4.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (27)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
